resource.chars:
In Salpa A. The only other organ contained 
in the circum-visceral sinus besides the intestine 
and ‘system of tubes ‘ is a mass of clear cells (ae)
rendered polygonal by mutual pressure and placed 
at the upper & back part of the sinus - to this 
body the name of Eleoblast has been given 
by Krohn - It has by some authors been <s>confo <\s>
confounded with <s>the <\s> a liver an organ to which it 
certainly has no analogy whatever - The Eleoblast 
is much larger & more conspicuous in the young 
than in the adult salpae and frequently but 
not always, its cells contain an oily matter -
<s>It would be <\s> There would seem to be no clue 
either to the homology or to the function of the
Eleoblast - Without hazarding a conjecture, it 
may be remarked, <s>that <\s> as a curious fact, that 
these animals so remarkable for possessing in 
the foetal state a true though rudimentary 
placental circulation - possess an organ 
which in structure & duration, somewhat calls 
to mind, the thymus gland -
The nervous system, consists of a single sub-
spherical ganglion (d) situate in the space between 
the inner & outer tunics, <s>[text?]<\s> just where the 
[text?] & the lower extremity of the <s>Gill<\s> hypopharyngeal band joins the 
<s>[text?]<\s> ventral paries - It gives off the delicate branches 
forward to the ‘languet’ (E1) and a great 
many in all directions to the parietes of the 
body - <s>[text?]<\s> There were no branches traceable specially 
to the mouth or to the oesophagus

rendered polygonal by mutual pressure and placed

body the name of Eleoblast has been given

certainly has no analogy whatever - The Eleoblast

not always, its cells contain an oily matter -
<s>It would be <\s> There would seem to be no clue

<s>[text?]<\s> ventral paries - It gives off two delicate branches

many in all directions to the parietes of the
